title: Team
text:
Principal and Quantitative Ecologist
Making ecological data work for conservation isn’t just about numbers - it’s about understanding what matters to the people doing vital conservation work. After 15 years in ecological data analysis and time in the non-profit sector, I’ve seen firsthand how organizations often struggle to transform their monitoring data into meaningful conservation actions.
That’s where I come in. I help conservation organizations tackle their data challenges, whether it’s designing wildlife monitoring plans, analyzing camera trap data, mapping connectivity corridors, or creating clear visualizations that tell their story. My approach combines statistical expertise with a deep appreciation for the practical realities of conservation work.
I specialize in wildlife monitoring analysis and connectivity mapping, but my skills extend to any project involving ecological data. From cleaning long-term datasets to creating automated workflows, from statistical design to compelling visualizations, if ecological data is slowing down your conservation work, I’m here to help.
What sets my work apart is my ability to make complex scientific concepts accessible. I explain things in plain language and create clear visuals so you always understand what the results mean and why they matter. My clients appreciate that I bring both statistical rigor and a collaborative, approachable style to every project.
My focus is on taking the stress out of the scientific process so conservation organizations can concentrate on what they do best. Whether you need help with a specific analysis or ongoing statistical support, I’m here to make sure your data works as hard as you do for conservation.


PhD in Environmental Science, Policy & Management | UC Berkeley
BA in Integrative Biology | UC Berkeley

title: Translating ecological data into conservation action
text:
What we do






Analyze wildlife data

Understand population trends, habitat use, and species distribution from your monitoring data
Design effective monitoring programs and create compelling visualizations to communicate your findings











Design resilient landscapes

Map climate-resilient wildlife corridors using spatial analysis and connectivity modeling
Inform conservation planning and adaptation strategies that ensure long-term ecosystem health











Streamline data workflows

Clean, organize, and manage your ecological data efficiently
Develop custom, reproducible workflows for analysis and reporting
Provide statistical design, analysis, and consulting











Visualize your impact

Communicate complex ecological data clearly and effectively with compelling maps, infographics, and figures
Create presentations and reports tailored for diverse audiences, from technical experts to the general public

title: Translating ecological data into conservation action
text:
Let’s collaborate
Pisaster empowers conservation organizations to take action with their ecological data. With expertise in wildlife monitoring, landscape connectivity, and advanced statistical analysis, we provide the clear, actionable insights needed to advance their mission to protect biodiversity and ecosystem resilience.
